sentence.Network_en: The case - fatality percentages were higher in the highly polluted areas.

sentence.Network_en: It did not shrink from such words as fatality, bondage and the like.
sentence.Network_cn: 它并不在乎诸如宿命 、 束缚之类的词语.

sentence.Network_en: It is my conviction , or my delusion , that crime brings its own fatality with it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我深信做坏事总没好报应.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (denoting the quality of causing death or disaster): from French fatalité or late Latin fatalitas, from Latin fatalis 'decreed by fate', from fatum (see fate). Sense 1 dates from the mid 19th cent

entry.def: A fatality is a death caused by an accident or by violence.

example.ex: Drunk driving fatalities have declined more than 10 percent over the past 10 years.
example.tran: 酒后驾车死亡人数在过去 10 年中下降了 10%以上。

entry.def: Fatality is the feeling or belief that human beings cannot influence or control events.

means.word_mean: 1. a death resulting from an accident or a disaster;

sentences.sentence: "a decrease in the number of automobile fatalities"

means.word_mean: 2. the quality of being able to cause death or fatal disasters

auth_sentence.content: I'm not surprised that a fatality has happened.
auth_sentence.res_content: I'm not surprised that a fatality has happened.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I'm not surprised that a fatality has happened.

auth_sentence.content: The textbooks describe an up to eighty-per-cent fatality rate.
auth_sentence.res_content: The textbooks describe an up to eighty-per-cent fatality rate.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The textbooks describe an up to eighty-per-cent fatality rate.

auth_sentence.content: Police say it appears the bomber was the lone fatality.
auth_sentence.res_content: Police say it appears the bomber was the lone fatality.

sentences.cn: 那宗意外道致多人死亡。

sentences.en: Britain has thousands of road fatalities every year.
sentences.cn: 在英国每年都有数千的人死于交通事故。
